Thiruvananthapuram.

Police Station in Crime No.889/2012.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused - Abdul Rahim, aged 44 years, S/o. Abdul Jabbar, TC. 46/263,
Puthuval Puthan Veedu, Manikyavilakom Ward, Muttathara
Village.
(By Advocate Sri. C.S.Sajadh)
Charge : Offences punishable under sections 323 and 324 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence : Accused is found not guilty of offences punishable under
sections 323 and 324 and he is acquitted of the said offences
under section 248(1) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. His
bail bond stand cancelled and he is set at liberty.

This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered the
following :-

2 of 5
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 323 and 324 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. The prosecution case in brief is as follows :- Due to the previous enmity, on
24.10.2012, at 19.00 hours, the accused at the road margin of Bypass road, near
Paruthikuzhi Junction, Puthanpalli Ward, Muttathara Village, the accused fisted
on the chest and face of CW1, when he fell down due to the hit, the accused hit
on his back with a granite piece resulting in injury. Thus accused committed
offences punishable under sections 323 and 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed by the Sub Inspector of police, Poonthura police station
before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II, Thiravananthapuram and
the case was taken on file as C.C. 1918/2012. Cognizance was taken for the
offences punishable u/ss. 323 and 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 against the
accused. Thereafter, it was transferred to this court, in pursuance of the order
of the Hon'ble Chief Judicial Magistrate, Thiruvananthapuram, the case was
refiled as CC. 1638/2018.

4. On appearance of the accused, he was enlarged on bail on 31.10.2012. Copies
of all relevant prosecution records were furnished to him under section 207
Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. After hearing prosecution and counsel for

3 of 5

accused charge framed for offences u/ss. 323 and 324 of Indian Penal Code,

1860 read over and explained to the accused to which he pleaded not guilty and

claimed to be tried.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 was examined and Ext. P1 was marked. As
the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the learned
Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW2 to CWE. In the absence of any
incriminating circumstances against the accused questioning of the accused
under section 313(1)(b) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 was dispensed with.
Accused was called upon to adduce evidence but no defence evidence was
adduced from the side of the accused.

6. Heard both sides and perued records.

7. The following points have arisen for determination:

(1) Whether on 24.10.2012, at 19.00 hours, at the road margin of Bypass road,
Paruthikuzhi Junction, Puthanpalli Ward, Muttathara Village, accused fisted
PW1 on his chest, face and shoulder and thereby accused committed an
offence punishable u/s. 323 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

(2) Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused hit PW1 on his
back with a dangerous granite piece resulting in injury and thereby accused
committed an offence punishable w/s. 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860?

(3) If the accused is found guilty? What is the order as to sentence?

4o0f5

8. Point Nos. 1 and 2 :-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point numbers 1 and
2 are considered together. Prosecution case is that accused has committed
offences punishable under sections 323 and 324 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

9. PW1, Mahin deposed that, he had given statement before the police regarding
the alleged incident of this case and he identified his signature in the first
information statement which is marked as Ext. P1. According to him the
accused was not assaulted him and he has no grievance against the accused.

10. The learned Assistant Public Prosecutor had given up other witnesses and he is
justified in doing so as the material witness did not support the case of
prosecution. Having considered evidence on record, this court is of the view
that prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of accused. For the said reason
these points are found against the prosecution.

11. Point No. 3 :- Upon the finding in point nos. 1 and 2 the accused is found not
guilty of offences punishable under sections 323 and 324 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860 and he is acquitted for the said offences under section 248(1) Code
of Criminal Procedure, 1973. His bail bond stand cancelled and he is set at
liberty.

5 of 5
The granite piece was produced before this court as T No. 538/2012 will be
destroyed after the appeal period is over according to law .
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me

Sd/-
Judicial I Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
